{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3361601,"name":"Daniel Wang ","username":"potatos","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/85e7bf/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-14T03:52:33.018Z","cooked":"

Throughout this year, we’ve developed multiple products through side projects and we’d like to make them all open source!

Check out all of our documentation (including files) here:

github.com

GitHub - RoboLancers/RoboLancers-Hardware: Custom Hardware designed by FRC team...

main

Custom Hardware designed by FRC team 321 . Contribute to RoboLancers/RoboLancers-Hardware development by creating an account on GitHub.

Vision

image1920×1080 62.9 KB

Helios, the Greek god of the Sun and Sight, is also the name of our integrated vision system.
With the rise of April Tag detection, field localization and complex game piece detection algorithms, the previous generation of cameras and processors just aren’t powerful enough. Helios is an open source vision system powered through PhotonVision that’s serves as a versatile solution with a base cost of under $200. Helios features:

  • Additional ports and computational power for 2 USB Cameras
  • Built in neural network accelerator
  • OV9281 sensor with 120FPS capture at 1280x800
  • FOV of 70°
  • Base cost of ~$200
  • Competition tested reliability
  • Entirely FDM 3d printed and COTs parts

Swerve Covers

image1920×1080 41.4 KB

With our initial implementation of swerve drive, we’ve noticed how long it took to replace and rewire a swerve pod if something broke.
With a cover designed to keep all debris out in addition to providing mounting holes for the SPARK MAX motor controller, wire routing holes for the CANcoder, WAGO slots for CANbus, these swerve pods replacements can be be fully wired off bot. Made for the SDS MK4i, the entire module can be taken off and replaced with just 6 screws, and kept as a spare part.
